definition: to have the courage to do sth/to dare to/bold in
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
to dare to be first/to pioneer (idiom)
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]

sentences.english: Still, who are we to say that we can stay?
sentences.chinese: 然而，谁有敢说我们能长留此地？

sentences.english: She was a very brave little girl – she dared to do all kinds of things.
sentences.chinese: 她是个很胆大的小女孩，她什么事都敢做。

sentences.english: Dare to look at the facts behind the foods you eat.
sentences.chinese: 你敢去看你吃的食物的幕后事实？

sentences.english: Who dares, and I compare? Who will win, who belongs to the Ministry of Supervision site.
sentences.chinese: 谁敢和我比？谁赢，监察部的地盘属于谁。

sentences.english: "Who dare bully my son?! "Father leads Son by the hand out ot the house.
sentences.chinese: “谁敢欺负我的乖儿子？”爸爸牵着儿子就往外走。

sentences.english: How dare you borrow it without my permission?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么敢未经我允许把它借走呢？

sentences.english: Maybe it is because that boasting is tax-free that they dare to boast more and more.
sentences.chinese: 也许因为吹牛是免税的，他们才敢大吹特吹。

sentences.english: To state outright and dare to remonstrate were his conduct of politics .
sentences.chinese: 直言敢谏是他从政品行的主要特点。

sentences.english: How dare you enter this building without permition .
sentences.chinese: 未经允许你怎么敢进入这幢大楼呢？

sentences.english: Did he dare to strike me when I was down?
sentences.chinese: 难道我倒下来时，他还敢打我吗？

sentences.english: Are you free to have a difference of opinion with others and express it without fear?
sentences.chinese: 当和别人意见相左时，你敢无所畏惧地表达出来吗？

sentences.english: If the enemy dare ener the village, we'll fight against them to the end.
sentences.chinese: 如果敌人敢进入村子，我们将和他们战斗到底。

sentences.english: If you can dream it, you can achieve it.
sentences.chinese: 只要你敢作梦，你就能实现它。

sentences.english: I had promised her a candle if she sent me money; and really, who could say that the prayer hadn’t come true?
sentences.chinese: 真的，谁敢说祷告了不能心想事成呢？

sentences.english: Do you dare to state your true name?
sentences.chinese: 你敢进来报出你的真实姓名吗？

definition: to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to have the courage to do sth/to dare to/bold in
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
fearless/not worried (by setbacks or difficulties)/even if/even though
to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
